title: Cultural roots and institutional transformations of teachers’ careers and the teaching profession in Europe
descriptions:
This grant proposal seeks to investigate the cultural roots and institutional transformations impacting teachers' careers and the teaching profession in Europe. The project will focus on the educational systems of Belgium, France, and England, addressing issues such as low attractiveness, fragmentation, and teacher shortages. Through a systematic comparative approach, the research aims to explain the nature of teacher policies, understand changes in the status of the teaching profession, analyze teacher allocation, and model and predict teacher attrition and migration.

The methodology will involve a post-comparative mixed-method design with work packages on teacher policy, supply, labor markets, and mobility. Data will be collected from national and international datasets, as well as original datasets on teacher mobility. Participant groups will include non-entrants and early leavers from the profession. The project outputs will contribute new theoretical knowledge and lead to a reconceptualization of institutional change in the teaching profession. By shedding light on the institutional dimensions affecting teachers' careers, this research will inform policy and practice to improve the attractiveness and sustainability of the teaching profession in Europe.

Data will be sourced from national and international datasets as well as original datasets on teacher mobility, with participant groups including non-entrants and early leavers. The project will contribute new theoretical knowledge and lead to a reconceptualization of institutional change in the teaching profession. By shedding light on the institutional dimensions affecting teachers' careers and the profession in Europe, the proposal aims to inform policy decisions and improve the overall quality of education in the region.
